item.title: [RETAGGIO] Retaggio Industries Ltd. Approves Allotment of Convertible Equity Warrants Worth Rs. 3,91,99,992/-
item.description:
Retaggio Industries Ltd. has approved the allotment of 15,07,692 Convertible Equity Warrants at an issue price of Rs. 26/- per warrant. The warrants are convertible into Equity Shares, amounting to Rs. 3,91,99,992/-. The Company has received 25% of the issue price, i.e. Rs. 6.50/- per warrant, amounting to Rs. 97,99,998/-. The Equity Shares to be allotted on exercise of the Warrants shall rank pari passu with the existing Equity Shares of the Company in all respects.

item.title: [ZSANMCOM] Trading Holiday Extends Open Offer Closing Date for Sanmitra Commercial Ltd
item.description:
Navigant Corporate Advisors Ltd, on behalf of Ankit Jalan and Anuj Jalan, along with Manju Jalan, Radhika Jalan, Prachi Jalan, Ritu Jalan, Divyanshi Jalan and Daivik Jalan, have issued a corrigendum to the Letter of Offer for Sanmitra Commercial Ltd. The corrigendum was published on 13th January 2026 in the Financial Express - English Daily (all editions); Jansatta - Hindi Daily (all editions) and Pratahkaal - Marathi Daily (Mumbai edition). The corrigendum is in compliance with the Securities and Exchange Board of India (Substantial Acquisition of Shares and Takeovers) Regulations, 2011, as amended. Due to a Trading Holiday declared on January 15, 2026, the tendering period for the Open Offer has been extended, and the Open Offer shall now close on January 20, 2026, instead of the earlier scheduled closing date of January 19, 2026.

  • Navigant Corporate Advisors Ltd issues corrigendum to the Letter of Offer for Sanmitra Commercial Ltd
  • Corrigendum published on 13th January 2026 in English, Hindi, and Marathi dailies
  • Trading Holiday declared on January 15, 2026, leading to the extension of the Open Offer

item.title: [IRFC] IRFC Faces Fine Over Board Composition and Committee Constitution Non-Compliance; Seeks Fine Waiver and Expedited Appointment of Independent Directors
item.description:
In its meeting held on 18th December, 2025, the Indian Railway Finance Corporation Ltd (IRFC) Board discussed and noted the non-compliance with the requirements pertaining to the composition of the Board and constitution of committees namely Audit and Nomination and Remuneration for the quarter ended 30th September 2025. The Exchanges imposed a fine on the Company for the non-compliance, which the IRFC Board desires to be waived. The Company has requested the appointing authority, the Ministry of Railways (MoR), to expedite the appointment of requisite number of Independent Directors, including one Women Independent Director, on the IRFC Board. The IRFC, being a Government Company, has no control over the appointment of Directors on its Board. The Board has previously faced similar non-compliance issues, and the NSE & BSE had waived fines imposed on the Company during the period of March, 2021 to December, 2021.

  • IRFC Board discussed non-compliance with Board composition and committee constitution requirements
  • Exchanges imposed a fine on the Company for non-compliance
  • IRFC Board seeks waiver of the fine imposed by the Exchanges
  • Company requests Ministry of Railways to expedite Independent Director appointments
  • IRFC has no control over the appointment of Directors on its Board

item.title: [NAVNETEDUL] Navneet Education Ltd. Announces Composite Scheme of Arrangement for Demerging Publishing Business of Indiannica Learning Private Limited
item.description:
Navneet Education Ltd. has submitted a Composite Scheme of Arrangement under Section 230 to 232 and Section 66 and other applicable provisions of the Companies, Act, 2013. The scheme proposes to demerge the 'Publishing Business' of Indiannica Learning Private Limited into Navneet Education Limited and reduce the equity share capital, preference share capital and securities premium of Indiannica Learning Private Limited. The scheme has been approved by the Board of Directors of both companies. Navneet Education Limited is primarily engaged in publishing, marketing, and distribution of educational books and related printed material, including but not limited to textbooks, workbooks and reference books for CBSE and ICSE curriculum. Indiannica Learning Private Limited is primarily engaged in the same business along with digital products and trading. The rationale behind this scheme is to ensure a seamless blend of traditional print and progressive digital platforms and a simplified group business structure.

  • Navneet Education Ltd. announces Composite Scheme of Arrangement
  • Proposal to demerge Publishing Business of Indiannica Learning Private Limited into Navneet Education Limited
  • Reduction of equity share capital, preference share capital and securities premium of Indiannica Learning Private Limited
  • Consolidation of publishing businesses of both companies
  • Seamless integration of content creation and technological development teams

item.description:

The changes are in response to observations from the National Stock Exchange of India Limited (NSE) and BSE Limited (BSE), and are in accordance with the SEBI (Issue of Capital and Disclosure Requirements) Regulations, 2018, the Companies Act, 2013, and relevant MCA circulars.
